poem:
Crash Bandicoot

A pixelated dance—
    She, conqueror of colored worlds,
Navigates the nostalgia-laden labyrinth;
    105% of joy
Red shell, no threat,
    in Mario Kart's endless circuit
but here—
    she reigns,
Luminous in 90s glow,
    where every molecule
Is memory,
    every moment,
Achievement.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Platformers are the most diabolical gaming genre. I should know There are only two video games my wife has ever enjoyed: Mario Kart, in which she has gleefully brought up the rear for the entirety of our family life; and Crash Bandicoot, of which she was, at one stage, the greatest player in the world. She completed every molecule of every Crash game in the 90s. I swear I saw her get 105% on one". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Platformers are the most diabolical gaming genre. I should know There are only two video games my wife has ever enjoyed: Mario Kart, in which she has gleefully brought up the rear for the entirety of our family life; and Crash Bandicoot, of which she was, at one stage, the greatest player in the world. She completed every molecule of every Crash game in the 90s. I swear I saw her get 105% on one
